intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. amoenotephrodes, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the genus Hieracium.
